basic.description: This second course in management accounting emphasizes the accounting concepts and analytical tools that are useful in planning and controlling organizational activity and in management decision-making. The principal costing systems and the related problems of cost estimation and cost allocations will be studied in greater depth than in the introductory course. A mixture of problem-solving exercises, discussion questions, cases, and readings may be employed.
basic.subject: COMM
basic.title: Intermed Management Accounting

extra.enrollment_requirement: Prerequisite   Level 2 and COMM112 or COMM212, and COMM162 or equivalent.
